entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 14.14 a-b** *आचार्यः कलशाज्जातः शरस्तम्बाद्गुरुः ___*
Who is described as the "guru" (teacher) in this verse?
A) Kripa B) Drona C) Bhishma D) Karna
entry.answer: A) Kripa • The verse explicitly names Kripa as the guru (guruḥ kṛpaḥ). • Drona and Bhishma are other teachers but not mentioned here. • Karna is a warrior, not a teacher in this context.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 19.19 a-b** *ततो दुर्योधनः ___ करे नृप | दीपिकाग्निकृतालोकस्तस्माद्रङ्गाद्विनिर्ययौ*
Who did Duryodhana cling to before fleeing?
A) Karna B) Bhima C) Arjuna D) Kritavarma
entry.answer: A) Karna • The verse states Duryodhana clung to Karna (karna-mālambyātha). • Bhima and Arjuna were fighting elsewhere; Kritavarma is unrelated. • Karna's presence is critical to the narrative of Duryodhana's desperation.

Which group of warriors went to their respective dwellings?
A) Pandavas with Drona and Kripa B) Kauravas with Bhishma C) Saindhavas with Karna D) Kalingas with Arjuna
entry.answer: A) Pandavas with Drona and Kripa • The verse explicitly lists Pandavas, Drona, and Kripa. • Bhishma is a separate figure; Karna and Kalingas are not mentioned here. • Drona and Kripa are allies of the Pandavas.

Which warrior was repeatedly called out by the people?
A) Arjuna B) Karna C) Duryodhana D) Bhishma
entry.answer: B) Karna • The verse mentions people calling "Karna" (karcit karna-iti). • Arjuna and Duryodhana are also named but not as the focus. • Bhishma's role is separate from this scene.

entry.question:

Whose son is described as "Aṅgeśvara" (Lord of the limb)?
A) Kunti's B) Draupadi's C) Gandhari's D) Subhadra's
entry.answer: A) Kunti's • The verse refers to Kunti's son (kuntyāśca pratyabhijñāya). • Draupadi and Subhadra are not mentioned here. • Gandhari's son is Duryodhana, but the context is different.

entry.question:

Whose fear caused Arjuna to flee?
A) Karna's B) Duryodhana's C) Bhishma's D) Kripa's
entry.answer: A) Karna's • The verse states Duryodhana approached Karna (karna-māsādya). • Arjuna's fear stems from Karna's presence. • Duryodhana and Bhishma are not the direct cause here.

entry.question:

Who is said to have no equal in archery on earth?

entry.answer: B) Karna • The verse explicitly states no one equals Karna (karna-tulyo). • Arjuna and Bhishma are archery rivals but not the focus here. • Duryodhana's role is separate from this claim.

What animal is described as "aditya-saṅkāśa" (resembling the sun)?

entry.answer: B) Tiger • The verse mentions "vyāghra" (tiger) as the animal. • "Mṛgī" (deer) is a distractor but not the answer. • Elephants and horses are not referenced here.

Who is described as "narendra" (king) in this verse?

entry.answer: B) Duryodhana • The verse refers to Duryodhana as the king (narendra). • Yudhishthira is the rightful king but not the focus here. • Bhishma and Kripa are advisors, not kings.
